messages.content: Where can I find the 'Generate on Cloud' button after installing the custom node?
You will find the 'Generate on Cloud' button on your right-hand panel below the 'Queue Prompt' button.
What should I do to start using ComfyUI-Cloud?
You need to create an account to start using ComfyUI-Cloud.
What happens after I name and upload my workflow?

The custom node will search for models, custom nodes, and images your workflow relies on and upload them to your cloud. It may take some time, especially if your workflow uses many custom nodes and models.
Where does the ComfyUI-Cloud node look for models, custom nodes, and images?

The ComfyUI-Cloud node exclusively searches for these within your ComfyUI folder. If you use models from Automatic1111 installation via extra_model_paths.yaml, you must move the models inside ComfyUI and deactivate Comfy's extra_model_paths.yaml.
What happens after the upload process?
A Comfy Cloud node will be created in your workflow, automatically executing your workflow in the cloud once. If you delete this Comfy Cloud node, you will need to re-upload your workflow.
How can I access cloud workflow runs?
You can access all cloud workflow runs by clicking the blue 'View past runs' button in your Comfy Cloud node.
Where can I find my most recent generation, and what information will be displayed?

To locate your most recent generation, scroll to the bottom of the table that pops up after clicking 'View past runs' and select the item with the latest timestamp. If your workflow requires significant time for generation, it will display progress, iterations per second, an estimated time for completion, and an option to halt execution.
What will happen to my charges if I halt my workflow execution?
Charges will only apply up to the point of termination.
Where will the generated image be displayed?
Upon successful generation, the panel will automatically display your generated image.
What is the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?

The ComfyUI-Cloud plugin is a custom node that enables you to run ComfyUI workflows using cloud GPU resources, allowing users without sufficient VRAM on their local machines to utilize cloud GPU resources for their workflows.
What are the benefits of using the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?

The benefits of using the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin include running workflows that require high VRAM, not having to bother with importing custom nodes/models into cloud providers, and not needing to spend cash for a new GPU.
How can I install the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?
To install the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin, you can follow these steps: 1. `cd custom_nodes` 2. `git clone https://github.com/nathannlu/comfyui-cloud.git` 3. Run your workflow!
Where can I find the Getting Started guide for the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?
You can find the Getting Started guide for the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin at: <https://github.com/nathannlu/ComfyUI-Cloud/blob/main/docs/get-started.md>
What GPU is used by the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?
The ComfyUI-Cloud plugin uses an Nvidia A10G 24GB VRAM GPU.
Who are the special thanks mentioned in the documentation?
The special thanks mentioned in the ComfyUI-Cloud documentation include NVIDIA, Modal Labs, ComfyAnonymous (the original creator of ComfyUI), and Benny Kok.
What is the purpose of the code of conduct for ComfyUI-Cloud?

The code of conduct is designed to make participation in the ComfyUI-Cloud community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of various personal attributes and to promote an open, welcoming, diverse, and inclusive environment.
What are examples of behavior that contributes positively to the ComfyUI-Cloud community?

Demonstrating empathy and kindness, being respectful of differing opinions, giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback, accepting responsibility and apologizing for mistakes, and focusing on what is best for the overall community are examples of positive behavior.
What is considered unacceptable behavior in the ComfyUI-Cloud community?

Unacceptable behavior includes the use of sexualized language, insulting comments, public or private harassment, sharing others' private information without permission, and other conduct considered inappropriate in a professional setting.
What enforcement responsibilities do community leaders have regarding the code of conduct?

Community leaders are responsible for enforcing the standards of acceptable behavior, and they have the right to remove, edit, or reject contributions that are not aligned with the code of conduct. They are also obligated to respect the privacy and security of incident reporters.
Are there any exceptions to the scope of the code of conduct?
The code of conduct applies within all community spaces and when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces.
What steps can be taken to report instances of harassment or other code of conduct violations in the ComfyUI-Cloud community?
Instances of harassment or code of conduct violations can be reported to community leaders at @extrafuzzy_ on Discord. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
What are the potential consequences for violating the code of conduct?
Consequences for violating the code of conduct can range from a private, written warning to a temporary or permanent ban from any sort of interaction or public communication within the community.
What is the source of the code of conduct for ComfyUI-Cloud?
The code of conduct for ComfyUI-Cloud is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html.
